name.namePart: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: USA v. Allee
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER denying 283 Motion to Continue as to Justin J. Allee (1). 28 U.S.C. Section 2254 and the rules of courtdo not authorize a district court to extend the deadline for filing a Section 2254 petition in orderto escape the bar of the statute of limitations enacted by Congress. However, I am willingto direct the Clerk of Court to docket filing no. 283 as a Section 2254 petition and to open a newcase with a filing date of April 13, 2005. I am also willing to grant Mr. Allee leave to amendthat Section 2254 petition.However, I will not take that course unless (a) Mr. Allee requests in writing that I doso, and (b) Mr. Allee sends the court either the $5 filing fee or an Application to ProceedIn Forma Pauperis ("IFP application"), both by no later than May 13, 2005. If the filing feeor an application to proceed IFP has been received by the court on or before May 13,2005, the documents will be filed as a new case with a filing date retroactive to the dateof filing no. 283, and a judge will be drawn to preside over the case.However, if the court has not received either the filing fee or an application toproceed IFP by May 13, 2005, no further action will be taken in respect to filing no. 283.The Clerk of Court shall send Mr. Allee the form for an IFP application. Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 4/25/2005. COPY MAILED with IFP application. (ADB)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER denying 283 Motion to Continue as to Justin J. Allee (1). 28 U.S.C. Section 2254 and the rules of courtdo not authorize a district court to extend the deadline for filing a Section 2254 petition in orderto escape the bar of the statute of limitations enacted by Congress. However, I am willingto direct the Clerk of Court to docket filing no. 283 as a Section 2254 petition and to open a newcase with a filing date of April 13, 2005. I am also willing to grant Mr. Allee leave to amendthat Section 2254 petition.However, I will not take that course unless (a) Mr. Allee requests in writing that I doso, and (b) Mr. Allee sends the court either the $5 filing fee or an Application to ProceedIn Forma Pauperis ("IFP application"), both by no later than May 13, 2005. If the filing feeor an application to proceed IFP has been received by the court on or before May 13,2005, the documents will be filed as a new case with a filing date retroactive to the dateof filing no. 283, and a judge will be drawn to preside over the case.However, if the court has not received either the filing fee or an application toproceed IFP by May 13, 2005, no further action will be taken in respect to filing no. 283.The Clerk of Court shall send Mr. Allee the form for an IFP application. Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 4/25/2005. COPY MAILED with IFP application. (ADB)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Allee
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER that 278, the Motion under 28 U.S.C. 2255 to Vacate filed bydefendant is denied. A separate judgment of dismissal with prejudice will be filed in accordance withthis Memorandum and Order, as to Justin J. Allee (1). Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 5/5/2005. (JAE, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Allee
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT - Pursuant to the Memorandum and Order entered on this date, 285 judgement is enteredin favor of the government and against the defendant. The defendant's Motion under 28U.S.C. 2255 to Vacate is dismissed with prejudice, as to defendant Justin J. Allee. Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 5/5/2005. (JAE, )

titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER permitting defendant to proceed on appeal in forma pauperis, as to defendant Justin J. Allee. Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 6/28/2005. (JAE, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER permitting defendant to proceed on appeal in forma pauperis, as to defendant Justin J. Allee. Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 6/28/2005. (JAE, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Allee
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER that Defendants Motion to Amend Title 28 U.S.C. 2255 to Vacate, Set Aside, orCorrect Sentence 289, and defendant's Motion to Stay Appeal Process 291, are granted. Defendant is granted three weeks from the date of this order in which to file a brief on the issues raised in the motions. The government shall have two weeks thereafter in which to respond. The Clerk is directed to send a copy of this order to the Clerk of the United States Court of Appeals for the Eighth Circuit, as to Justin J. Allee (1). Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 8/2/2005. (JAE, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER that Defendants Motion to Amend Title 28 U.S.C. 2255 to Vacate, Set Aside, orCorrect Sentence 289, and defendant's Motion to Stay Appeal Process 291, are granted. Defendant is granted three weeks from the date of this order in which to file a brief on the issues raised in the motions. The government shall have two weeks thereafter in which to respond. The Clerk is directed to send a copy of this order to the Clerk of the United States Court of Appeals for the Eighth Circuit, as to Justin J. Allee (1). Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 8/2/2005. (JAE, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Allee
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 300 Motion to Extend Time to File Motion to Alter or Amend theJudgment. Defendant is granted until October 17, 2005 in which to file a motion to alter or amend the judgment. The government shall have two weeks thereafter in which torespond, as to Justin J. Allee (1). Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 8/30/2005. (JAE, )
